TopicTitle: Hawkinator's almost-multiplayer pass along the save file challenge thingy.

Articles.Content:
CHALLENGE 81 COMPLETED!

Kerbals Lost: 0

After a fairly uneventful but nauseating flight in the "Slinkee" Low Orbit Fuel Depo (yes I did actually rename it, and change it from a lander to a station in the sort menu:wink:), Orbart made it into low orbit around the mun's equator and is ready for docking.

Meanwhile, back at KSC there is a radical new design ready for it's first flight!

This 40 ton monster is ready to be put into orbit, so it can begin KSC's master plan of total solar system domination!...What? there are no alien races in the game? I guess you could just fly it to Duna or Eve or some other planet with an atmosphere and fly around for a bit before coming back to Kerbin then.

Challenge #82:

This is your mission, if you choose to accept it.

Fly the Star Destroyer SSAO into orbit. It has just enough fuel to make it to Duna after making orbit (but not back) so you should have plenty of fuel to spare. Once in orbit the plan is to refuel it at a fuel station later so we can send it to Eve or Duna (if we have a fuel station around Jool we could send it there, but I stopped reading what was going on at page 17 so I have no idea).

If you're new to flying SSAOs, just getting into orbit will probably be enough for you. If getting into orbit wasn't much of a challenge, you can proceed to step two and dock it with a fuel station for fueling (I'm pretty sure we have a station up with fuel in it, right?).

1 key toggles jets (lower one starts losing power at altitude first for some reason. if you're pitching down a lot, that's why)

2 toggles nukes (use this and the LV-30 once jets start losing power)

3 toggles the LV-30 (don't use this once out of atmosphere)

4 opens/closes the high altitude intakes (close these at first, then open when the 4 main are not enough)

5 opens/closes the main intakes (close these and the high alt intakes when jets are disabled and you're using rockets, to reduce drag)

You might want to turn off the two front RCS for docking, they're used mainly for pitch/yaw and aren't aligned with the center of mass like the other RCS are. It has about 5x as much RCS fuel as the Slinkee though so you should be fine either way.

Here is the Save File

EDIT: In the future, DO NOT TAKE THIS TO EVE. I just tried it, and the thick atmosphere forces the center of lift even further forward while the center of gravity is farther back, even with fuel redistributing. It will stay backwards the whole flight. you can still land it (backwards), but besides that, it'll be useless and stranded. Ther "air" in Eve isn't even compatible with the engines, so you can't use it for really efficent SSAO anyway. The thinner atmosphere of Duna would be a safer bet (especially if it's actual air), since we don't have the updated version I made (with even more wings on the back) in orbit or anything

Edited June 3, 2013 by Tripod27

ETA: 2hrs

LKO orbit achieved...

Preparing to dock...

Refueling...

Uploading save...

Edited June 3, 2013 by ThePsuedoMonkey
Phew, someone else took it . I had managed to get the destroyer up to shiva several times but the fuel balance always seemed off, and I couldn't dock it with my computron's lag Goodluck!

Ah, if I knew someone else was already working on it I would've waited I'll hurry up and finish then, so that you can do the next one

Challenge #82 Completed

Total Kerbals lost: 2

Total Extra-Kerbin landings: 8

The Star Destroyer has reached orbit. It was a little difficult to dock with the temporary fuel depot, but the Garbage Truck mk2 served as an excellent attachment point:

For this challenge, the Tranquility lounger is ready to launch. Board two more kerbals on her, send her into orbit, and circularize on the Rockmax 24-77's (careful not to drop them), then time-warp 24hrs or so. Optional objective: design a module to counter-balance the (16.24T) Tranquility lounger for when the Valkyrie transports her to Lathe.

The launch vehicle feeds off the FLT-800's until the SRB's drop, and has enough dV to reach orbit. The radial thrusters are meant to de-orbit the module on Laythe, and she should have enough parachutes to land alone. There is only one docking port and no RCS though.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B6828vVl_-ZoUml0SkRySHJWN28/edit?usp=sharing

Edited June 3, 2013 by ThePsuedoMonkey

Heh, I guess covering the thing with wings does make fuel a bit hard to balance

I'm pretty sure I set the fuel to transfer from the jet tanks to the rocket tank to the nuke tanks, so as long as you can see a sliver of the nuke tank you can pull it from there and put it anywhere else without worrying too much

So for the lounger do you have a ladder on the bottom or would a mod like crew manifest be recommended? (just curious, doing two challenges in a row seems a bit selfish so I'll let someone else grab this one)
Yeah, I forgot to deploy the ladders (action group #4), but they will let you load the kerbals into the hitchhiker module. I've not used Crew Manifest, but it sounds like It'd work equally well.

Here's a quick overview of the save:

Total Kerbals lost: 2

RIP Hudfrid Kerman (5/3/13)

I feel like there should be a lot more ships awaiting transfers in Alarm Clock. The Duna Habitat for example must also be going to Duna, no?

Maybe some alarms were lost somewhere with all the new updates, or maybe I'm doing something wrong. Either way, this tells us what is out there and what it's currently doing.

Also, I posted a pic on page 34 that illustrates how to download a save from Google Docs, and have a picture tutorial on how to set up and share HERE

It may be nice to add links to these in the original post for those who aren't sure how to do it.

Edited June 3, 2013 by Jenkinz

Aldbus Kerman

Edited June 3, 2013 by dracklen

Challenge #83 Completed

Total Kerbals lost: 2

Total Extra-Kerbin landings: 8

First step was to get a couple of extra Kerbals into our space ship! After several iterations, a quick-and-dirty crew transport ship was made. While the turning radius on this beast is nothing to boast about, our two new explorers, Fredsby Kerman and Aldbus Kerman were quickly boarded.

A few minutes later they were seventy five thousand meters closer to their destiny!

The trip took slightly more fuel due to a few careless piloting errors, but there should be plenty left for their future docking with the Valkyrie for their final journey.

Also accomplished was a quick refueling mission to the "Slinkie" to give it some RCS in case it ever needs to see action.

Challenge 84:

Charon is Currently in orbit and needs to get back to the Shiva station, which is currently becoming rather crowded! Get Charon back to the station and refueled.

Optional Challenge: We still need another module to counter-balance the (16.24T) Tranquility lounger for when the Valkyrie transports her to Lathe.

Save File: Here!

Edited June 3, 2013 by dracklen

Challenge #85 Complete!

Total Kerbals Lost: 2

The Act Crop. Laythe Lander has been docked with the Valkyrie.

Bill and Jeb are continuing north. Their picnic has somehow caused sub-space to shatter and a temporal rift has created doppelganger copies of them!

Next challenge:

Fly the recently re-equiped Dionysus mk2 north to pick up the doppelganger Bill and Jeb to be returned to the KSC. Command wants to put them to use in space somewhere.

Also, time accelerate 24 hours.

Challenge #86 Completed

Total rescue missions: 4

Next event: Moho transfer window in 10 days

The short rescue trip was deftly handled by the Dionysus mk2. Bill didn't seem to appreciate it as much as Jeb though.

Those metal rover seats are probably uncomfortable for long-term use, so your challenge is to design and deploy a mobile habitation module for as many kerbals as possible using 50 parts, and load all our off-duty kerbals near KSC into it.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B6828vVl_-ZoTFFLUzA3Q2h0X2M/edit?usp=sharing

Cheers, brave challengers!

Challenge Accepted!

Made orbit just fine.

Deorbited booster stage.

Trying to line this bad boy up...

Apologies for the delay! My internet decided to die on my halfway through!

Total Completed Challenges: 85

Total Kerbals lost: 2

Total Extra-Kerbin landings: 8

The probe launched without much incident, but once we hit orbit and deorbited the launch stage, the probe managed to miss the station several times.

Fortunately the ion engines are pretty good for this sort of thing, and a few minutes later, the probe was safely docked in its assigned location.

Challenge 86:

Get the Minmus Observatory to Minmus, preferably with the experimental rover intact. Ideal landing spots would be near the equator on a hill to maximize field of vision. The launch system is a bit weird, but assuming it doesn't blow up, it should be enough to get our brave astronomy team into orbit, and the nuclears can do the rest! 1 Controls the 4 nuclears on the lander, and 2 controls the ladders which should allow for each kerbal to exit. Don't forget to plant a flag!

Save File (D'oh, knew I was forgettign something): Here!
